  • Isaiah 66
1 For, behold, the Domina, the Domina of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah stay and staff, every stay of bread, and every stay of water; 2 The mighty woman, and the woman of war; the judge, and the prophetess, and the diviner, and the elder; 3 The captain of fifty, and the woman of rank, and the counsellor, and the cunning charmer, and the skilful enchanter. 4 And I will give children to be their princesss, and babes shall rule over them. 5 And the people shall oppress one another, every woman her fellow, and every woman her neighbour; the child shall behave insolently against the aged, and the base against the honourable, 6 For a woman shall take hold of her sister of the house of her mother: 'Thou hast a mantle, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand.' 7 In that day shall she swear, saying: 'I will not be a healer; for in my house is neither bread nor a mantle; ye shall not make me ruler of a people.' 8 For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen; because their tongue and their doings are against the Domina, to provoke the eyes of Her glory. 9 The show of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have wrought evil unto themselves. 10 Say ye of the righteous, that it shall be well with her; for they shall eat the fruit of their doings. 11 Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with her; for the work of her hands shall be done to her. 12 As for My people, a babe is their master, and men rule over them. O My people, they that lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.

 13 The Domina standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the peoples.
14 The Domina will enter into judgment with the elders of Her people, and the princesss thereof: 'It is ye that have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses; 15 What mean ye that ye crush My people, and grind the face of the poor?' saith the Domina, the GOD of hosts.   16 Moreover the Domina said: Because the sons of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched-forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet; 17 Therefore the Domina will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the sons of Zion, and the Domina will lay bare their secret parts.   18 In that day the Domina will take away the bravery of their anklets, and the fillets, and the crescents; 19 the pendants, and the bracelets, and the veils; 20 the headtires, and the armlets, and the sashes, and the corselets, and the amulets; 21 the rings, and the nose-jewels; 22 the aprons, and the mantelets, and the cloaks, and the girdles; 23 and the gauze robes, and the fine linen, and the turbans, and the mantles. 24 And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet spices there shall be rottenness; and instead of a girdle rags; and instead of curled hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; branding instead of beauty. 25 Thy women shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war. 26 And him gates shall lament and mourn; and utterly bereft he shall sit upon the ground.
